7.18.19  10:35 am   i hope no one has asked you this, but what is happening in 1:47 on "long long long journey" ?

https://youtu.be/0jEm6owSKFU?t=107

The high frequency beeping is really interesting, as it seems to be irregular rhythms/non-linear. if i slow it down, it seems to be live as it is not exactly equal spacing for all notes.

this is my attempt at transcribing the first bar, ignoring unequal note spacing, with x as beep, and o as a rest

xxxo|xxox|oxxo|xoxo|

thanks a ton if you answer it!

      the behavior seems to be that of a timbale player. it's all transcribable as 16th notes, but consider some of them flams. and the rhythm is stretched ever so slightly. i think if you imagine a loud timbale player is briefly having his/her party moment, it may become clear. also it's not a loop, it's a full take played through, so you're not gonna get the same thing for each bar

      gives it more of a slant

7.17.19  9:56 pm   tips on using vocal EQ because I can't find the best setting, please?

      do it with no setting, and just leave it that way until you get sick of it, and then go in and edit it, specifically editing out the part you are sick of

7.17.19  9:30 pm   couldn't you prevent anyone from answering the same exact question you already answered, by redirecting them to said questioN?

      yes, i do that on the anagrams page, but that would become problematic on the questions page because sometimes the answer to the same question changes. like "what day is it"

7.17.19  9:25 pm   what's the biggest waste of time

      time cannot be wasted. it stops when nothing is happening

7.17.19  9:05 pm   If Steve isn't Steve than who is Steve?

7.17.19  8:55 pm   What genre is your music?

      you'll have to listen and see

7.17.19  7:45 pm   any tips for making a living out of your art?

     step 1 is to decide how yours it is. then spend the according amount of time developing it for its prime audience (you, depending on how yours you want it to be). then once you feel you absolutely cannot satisfy that audience any greater, then go ahead and hit the market, and quite frankly it doesn't matter which market. if you've completed steps 1 through 3 you should have plenty of staying power due to confidence, and the product will be more than ready by then

      you know, what was that experience like for you,

     confusing, until i unlocked a few simple secrets

      and what hurdles should i expect when pursuing that endeavor?

      confusion, not knowing what's going on, etc

7.17.19  7:33 pm   help im a nordic raider and the village im saving is burning what do i do?

      try singing a rune

7.17.19  6:48 pm   should you always cling onto yourself if you don't know what you are?

      no

7.17.19  6:45 pm   do you think a batch process (write 5 songs, record all 5, then mix all 5, master them, etc) could ever work for you?

      yes. in a way, my writing/recording/video process could be considered batch processes, because the entire songwriting is done first, then the entire song recording is done, then the entire video is done

      i might be experiencing it now

7.17.19  12:15 pm   What is your opinion?

      1=2

7.17.19  12:13 pm   I've been considering making stock music as some sort of investment for my future, since apparently somewhere people pay for this and if I have a collection online, then future people may send me some small amount of future money randomly throughout the future.  What are your thoughts?

      that could be a good idea. but depending on what type of artist/creator you are, this may give you a deep feeling of emptiness, and it will be nearly impossible to go through with it, in which case don't

7.17.19  12:10 pm   What's your speed at coming up with new song ideas?

     about 1.2

        I feel like I can instantly come up with a bunch of musical ideas that are beautiful and fresh and have potential to be impactful.  I definitely struggle lyrically though. Without lyrics is it all pointless?  

     no

      Also, for you, once you have an idea decided upon is it a pretty linear process to the song being finished?  

     yes

      Or could the same idea turn out in different ways and still be good?

     yes

      Is potentiality an illusion?  

     i was going to say no but now that i think about it yes

      How do you deal with possibilities and the chance something could be way different and somewhat better, somehow.

     speed up

7.17.19  9:49 am   Hey, could you recommend something to listen to to me? Any genre will do

      pink noise
